text: today I'm gonna show you how to dip
stuff in chocolate without losing your

chocolate it's not complicated but it's

which is actually more accurate and all

hundred and fifteen degrees and this is
Fahrenheit this never gets very hot

and eighty-eight degrees what you need
to do is melt the chocolate slowly over
a double boiler as I've done until it's
a hundred and fifteen degrees there
about between 112 116 in there will work
then you need to bring the temperature

what's called seeding the chocolate and
seeding the chocolate just means taking
pieces of the same chocolate you use to
begin with and stirring it in measuring
all the while until the temperature
comes down to 91 degrees at that point
and I'll show you you can start dipping
like mad and when that temperature falls
below 88 degrees you have to stop
dipping bring the temperature back up to

there's nothing better strawberries of
course
